FuncDef: This command executes the contents of a text file as if they were CLI commands entered at the console.

ParaDef.Info: Echoes the contents of the exec file to the session screen as it executes. ParamDefault: Default- echo disabled

Performs a syntax check of the file without executing the commands. Syntax checking will be able to find invalid commands and keywords, but it will not be able to validate erroneous user- supplied parameters. ParamDefault: Default- execute file commands
Specifies the text file with CLI commands to execute, up to 256 characters in length.

Specifies the ASCII printable string used to indicate the end of the exec file when stdin is used as the exec file source. <Ctrl-C> and "EOF" can always be used to terminate an exec file sourced from stdin up to 254 characters in length. ParamDefault: Default- EOF
Specifies up to five arguments, each up to 254 characters in length.
